sessions.section: The Dates/Times below are for a Hands-On Session ( Step 2 ) for an AHA online course. * If you need Step 1 : Once you choose a date to test, you will be offered Class Type selections. (e.g., First Aid CPR/AED, Pediatric First Aid CPR, etc.) If you are seeking a Merchant Mariner First Aid Certification , add both TOTAL and the AMERHA-216 options. Bloodborne Pathogens can be added to any selection. The Heartsaver Online courses are taught in a blended learning format. Students must complete the online portion, followed by the hands-on skills session conducted by an American Heart Association Training Center Instructor. Upon successful completion, students will receive a Heartsaver Course Completion Card , valid for 2 years. The AHA’s Heartsaver courses are designed for individuals with little or no medical training who require first aid and/or CPR training for job requirements, regulatory compliance (OSHA), or personal preparedness. The AHA's Heartsaver Online Courses Are Available in the Following Options: First Aid with CPR/AED TOTAL ( Click for course details ) Comprehensive course designed to meet OSHA and other regulatory requirements. Includes all available course topics. Meets US Coast Guard Elementary First Aid training requirements. Estimated Online Course Time: 1.25 to 3 hours. First Aid with CPR/AED BASIC ( Click for course details ) Flexible course with optional topics. Estimated Online Course Time: 1.25 to 3 hours. Pediatric First Aid and CPR/AED Focuses on infants and children (adult training is optional). Ideal for childcare workers, teachers, and camp counselors. Estimated Online Course Time: 1.5 to 3 hours. CPR/AED Only Teaches how to perform CPR and use an AED safely and effectively. Estimated Online Course Time: 1 to 1.5 hours. First Aid Only For individuals needing a First Aid completion card to meet job, regulatory, or other requirements. Estimated Online Course Time: 1.5 hours. Bloodborne Pathogens Designed for workers likely to encounter bloodborne pathogens, including healthcare workers, security personnel, and tattoo artists. Estimated Online Course Time: 1 hour. This course can be completed 100% online. Upon completion of the online portion, bring your Certificate of Completion to class or email it to info@910cpr.com .

sessions.title: 📚 What You’ll Learn:
sessions.section: 🧸 Heartsaver Pediatric First Aid CPR AED Be ready. Be confident. Be the one who helps. Learn to recognize and respond to the most common childhood emergencies with the American Heart Association’s Heartsaver® Pediatric First Aid CPR AED course — a must-have for anyone responsible for the safety of infants and children. 🖥️ Part 1: Complete the interactive online modules at your own pace 🏥 Part 2: Attend a brief, hands-on skills check to complete certification ✅ AHA certification valid for 2 years 💵 All included in one simple price! 📚 What You’ll Learn: 🤒 Illness & injury response 🩹 Bleeding control & bandaging 🤧 Allergic reactions & EpiPen use 😮‍💨 Asthma emergencies 🌊 Drowning response 🐝 Bites & stings 🔥 Burns 💓 CPR & AED for children and infants 🫁 Choking relief techniques 👨‍🦳 (Optional) Adult CPR & AED overview 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Perfect For: 🧑‍🏫 Child Care Workers & Teachers 👩‍👧 Foster Parents & Guardians 🛟 Lifeguards & Camp Staff 🧢 Youth Sports Coaches 🍼 Babysitters & Nannies 👵 Grandparents & New Parents 🧒 After-School & Youth Program Leaders Whether you're a licensed childcare provider or simply someone who cares for kids, this course will give you the tools and confidence to respond when it matters most. 🎯 Meets training requirements in most U.S. states for professional caregivers 📍 Available in a blended format (online learning + in-person skills) 🔗 Register now and protect the little ones in your care »

Learn to recognize and respond to the most common childhood emergencies with the American Heart Association’s Heartsaver® Pediatric First Aid CPR AED course — a must-have for anyone responsible for the safety of infants and children. 🖥️ Part 1: Complete the interactive online modules at your own pace 🏥 Part 2: Attend a brief, hands-on skills check to complete certification ✅ AHA certification valid for 2 years 💵 All included in one simple price! 📚 What You’ll Learn: 🤒 Illness & injury response 🩹 Bleeding control & bandaging 🤧 Allergic reactions & EpiPen use 😮‍💨 Asthma emergencies 🌊 Drowning response 🐝 Bites & stings 🔥 Burns 💓 CPR & AED for children and infants 🫁 Choking relief techniques 👨‍🦳 (Optional) Adult CPR & AED overview 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Perfect For: 🧑‍🏫 Child Care Workers & Teachers 👩‍👧 Foster Parents & Guardians 🛟 Lifeguards & Camp Staff 🧢 Youth Sports Coaches 🍼 Babysitters & Nannies 👵 Grandparents & New Parents 🧒 After-School & Youth Program Leaders Whether you're a licensed childcare provider or simply someone who cares for kids, this course will give you the tools and confidence to respond when it matters most. 🎯 Meets training requirements in most U.S. states for professional caregivers 📍 Available in a blended format (online learning + in-person skills) 🔗 Register now and protect the little ones in your care »

sessions.location: NC - Burgaw: 111 S Wright St @ 910CPR's Office
sessions.title: What is covered
sessions.section: The Heartsaver First Aid / CPR / AED program covers Adult, Child, Infant CPR with AED and Choking with various First Aid topics. Designed for employee training in workplaces, scouting leaders, coaches, and non-medical home care workers. For employees and/or designated first responders who have a duty to respond to a first aid or cardiac emergency because of job responsibilities or regulatory requirements. What is covered Adult first aid (first aid basics, medical and injury emergencies) Adult, child and infant CPR Foreign-body airway obstruction Use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED) Includes 2-year AHA Completion Card

sessions.title: 📌Course Highlights:
sessions.section: HSI Adult First Aid | CPR AED - In-Person Training The HSI Adult First Aid | CPR AED course is a nationally recognized, instructor-led program that teaches essential skills for responding to medical emergencies involving adults, children, and infants. Participants will learn how to provide high-quality CPR, use an AED, and offer effective first aid in real-world situations—from workplace incidents to home-based emergencies. 📌 Course Highlights: Comprehensive Curriculum: Includes CPR, AED use, choking relief, bleeding control, burns, shock, and more. Evidence-Based Training: Follows the latest ILCOR resuscitation science and the 2020 AHA Guidelines for CPR and ECC. 🩺 Who Should Enroll? This course is ideal for non-healthcare professionals and workplace responders, including: Emergency response teams Teachers, coaches, and childcare staff Adult residential caregivers Fitness instructors and health club personnel General public looking to be better prepared for emergencies 🛥️ Also Approved for Maritime Personnel: For individuals seeking a Merchant Mariner Credential , this course meets the USCG Elementary First Aid and CPR requirement under 46 CFR 11.201. Successful maritime students will receive: A 2-year HSI Adult First Aid | CPR AED certification card A HSINST-203 Recognition of Participation document accepted by the United States Coast Guard This approval is granted by the USCG National Maritime Center and ensures compliance for those pursuing or renewing USCG licenses. 🎓 Course Format: In-Person, Instructor-Led: Includes hands-on skill sessions and guided practice with certified instructors. 🏆 National Recognitions: OSHA Compliant: Meets workplace safety training requirements USCG Accepted: Approved under course code HSINST-203 FAA, ACA, NREMT Approved: Recognized by aviation, EMS, and camp staff organizations Whether you're in the classroom, the workplace, or the wheelhouse of a boat—this course delivers the hands-on confidence and certification you need to respond when it matters most.
sessions.start_text: Wednesday, November 12, 2025 at 9:15 AM NC - Wilmington: 4018 Shipyard Blvd @ 910CPR's Office

This course is ideal for non-healthcare professionals and workplace responders, including: Emergency response teams Teachers, coaches, and childcare staff Adult residential caregivers Fitness instructors and health club personnel General public looking to be better prepared for emergencies 🛥️ Also Approved for Maritime Personnel: For individuals seeking a Merchant Mariner Credential , this course meets the USCG Elementary First Aid and CPR requirement under 46 CFR 11.201. Successful maritime students will receive: A 2-year HSI Adult First Aid | CPR AED certification card A HSINST-203 Recognition of Participation document accepted by the United States Coast Guard This approval is granted by the USCG National Maritime Center and ensures compliance for those pursuing or renewing USCG licenses. 🎓 Course Format: In-Person, Instructor-Led: Includes hands-on skill sessions and guided practice with certified instructors. 🏆 National Recognitions: OSHA Compliant: Meets workplace safety training requirements USCG Accepted: Approved under course code HSINST-203 FAA, ACA, NREMT Approved: Recognized by aviation, EMS, and camp staff organizations Whether you're in the classroom, the workplace, or the wheelhouse of a boat—this course delivers the hands-on confidence and certification you need to respond when it matters most.

sessions.title: 📌Course Highlights:
sessions.section: HSI Adult First Aid | Adult/Child/Infant CPR AED - Blended Learning The HSI Adult First Aid | Adult/Child/Infant CPR AED course is a comprehensive blended learning program combining online instruction with an in-person, instructor-led skills session . This format allows for flexible self-paced online learning while ensuring hands-on practice with essential life-saving techniques . 📌 Course Highlights: Blended Learning: Complete engaging online modules covering first aid, CPR, and AED use, followed by an in-person skills session. Comprehensive Coverage: Learn to respond effectively to emergencies involving adults, children, and infants , including choking, cardiac arrest, and trauma Up-to-Date Content: Follows the latest ILCOR & AHA 2020 Guidelines for CPR & Emergency Cardiovascular Care (ECC). 🩺 Who Should Enroll? This course is perfect for non-healthcare professionals who require or desire CPR and first aid training, including: Emergency response teams in workplaces Fitness trainers and health club staff Adult residential caregivers Teachers, coaches, and childcare providers Anyone interested in gaining essential first aid & CPR skills 🎓 Course Components: Online Learning: Complete interactive training modules at your own pace. In-Person Skills Session: Attend an instructor-led session for hands-on practice and evaluation. 📜 Certification: Upon successful completion of the online and in-person components, participants will receive a 2-year HSI First Aid | CPR AED certification . Gain the confidence and knowledge to respond effectively in emergency situations and make a difference in your community!

This format allows for flexible self-paced online learning while ensuring hands-on practice with essential life-saving techniques . 📌 Course Highlights: Blended Learning: Complete engaging online modules covering first aid, CPR, and AED use, followed by an in-person skills session. Comprehensive Coverage: Learn to respond effectively to emergencies involving adults, children, and infants , including choking, cardiac arrest, and trauma Up-to-Date Content: Follows the latest ILCOR & AHA 2020 Guidelines for CPR & Emergency Cardiovascular Care (ECC). 🩺 Who Should Enroll? This course is perfect for non-healthcare professionals who require or desire CPR and first aid training, including: Emergency response teams in workplaces Fitness trainers and health club staff Adult residential caregivers Teachers, coaches, and childcare providers Anyone interested in gaining essential first aid & CPR skills 🎓 Course Components: Online Learning: Complete interactive training modules at your own pace. In-Person Skills Session: Attend an instructor-led session for hands-on practice and evaluation. 📜 Certification: Upon successful completion of the online and in-person components, participants will receive a 2-year HSI First Aid | CPR AED certification . Gain the confidence and knowledge to respond effectively in emergency situations and make a difference in your community!
sessions.start_text: Wednesday, December 17, 2025 at 5:00 PM NC - Wilmington: 4018 Shipyard Blvd @ 910CPR's Office

Comprehensive Coverage: Learn to respond effectively to emergencies involving adults, children, and infants , including choking, cardiac arrest, and trauma Up-to-Date Content: Follows the latest ILCOR & AHA 2020 Guidelines for CPR & Emergency Cardiovascular Care (ECC). 🩺 Who Should Enroll? This course is perfect for non-healthcare professionals who require or desire CPR and first aid training, including: Emergency response teams in workplaces Fitness trainers and health club staff Adult residential caregivers Teachers, coaches, and childcare providers Anyone interested in gaining essential first aid & CPR skills 🎓 Course Components: Online Learning: Complete interactive training modules at your own pace. In-Person Skills Session: Attend an instructor-led session for hands-on practice and evaluation. 📜 Certification: Upon successful completion of the online and in-person components, participants will receive a 2-year HSI First Aid | CPR AED certification . Gain the confidence and knowledge to respond effectively in emergency situations and make a difference in your community!
sessions.start_text: Wednesday, February 11, 2026 at 5:00 PM NC - Wilmington: 4018 Shipyard Blvd @ 910CPR's Office

sessions.course_title: Wednesday, November 12, 2025 at 9:15 AM NC - Wilmington: 4018 Shipyard Blvd @ 910CPR's Office
sessions.section: The Adult and Pediatric First Aid/CPR/AED course incorporates the latest science and teaches students to recognize and care for a variety of first aid emergencies such as burns, cuts, scrapes, sudden illnesses, head, neck, back injuries, heat and cold emergencies and how to respond to breathing and cardiac emergencies to help victims of any age - adults (about 12 years and older) and pediatric (infants and children up to 12 years of age). Students who successfully complete this course will receive a certificate for Adult and Pediatric First Aid/CPR/AED valid for two years. Includes: 2-year ARC Certification Card

Includes: 2-year ARC Certification Card

sessions.title: 💳 Same-day certification includes both AHA eCard and AMERHA-216 form
sessions.course_title: 💳 Same-day certification includes both AHA eCard and AMERHA-216 form
sessions.section: 💳 Same-day certification includes both AHA eCard and AMERHA-216 form The American Heart Association’s Heartsaver® First Aid CPR AED (TOTAL) course is officially recognized by the U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) as meeting the full training requirement for Elementary First Aid . This instructor-led course includes hands-on training in adult first aid, CPR, AED use, and choking relief , and is ideal for mariners, maritime professionals, and others seeking credentials that meet USCG standards. This program meets: STCW Code Table A-VI/1-3: Elementary First Aid 46 CFR 11.302(a)(3) and 12.602(a)(3) 46 CFR 11.201(i)(1) – First Aid & CPR training requirements Course ID: AMERHA-216 Certification: AHA Heartsaver® eCard (valid for 2 years) and signed USCG form AMERHA-216 provided same day Duration: ~2.5 to 3.5 hours depending on group size and skill level This training is delivered in accordance with the AHA PAM and has been reviewed and accepted by the U.S. Coast Guard National Maritime Center (NMC).
sessions.start_text: Wednesday, November 12, 2025 at 9:15 AM NC - Wilmington: 4018 Shipyard Blvd @ 910CPR's Office

This program meets: STCW Code Table A-VI/1-3: Elementary First Aid 46 CFR 11.302(a)(3) and 12.602(a)(3) 46 CFR 11.201(i)(1) – First Aid & CPR training requirements Course ID: AMERHA-216 Certification: AHA Heartsaver® eCard (valid for 2 years) and signed USCG form AMERHA-216 provided same day Duration: ~2.5 to 3.5 hours depending on group size and skill level This training is delivered in accordance with the AHA PAM and has been reviewed and accepted by the U.S. Coast Guard National Maritime Center (NMC).

This program meets: STCW Code Table A-VI/1-3: Elementary First Aid 46 CFR 11.302(a)(3) and 12.602(a)(3) 46 CFR 11.201(i)(1) – First Aid & CPR training requirements Course ID: AMERHA-216 Certification: AHA Heartsaver® eCard (valid for 2 years) and signed USCG form AMERHA-216 provided same day Duration: ~2.5 to 3.5 hours depending on group size and skill level This training is delivered in accordance with the AHA PAM and has been reviewed and accepted by the U.S. Coast Guard National Maritime Center (NMC).

sessions.title: blended learning option
sessions.section: ** Same-day certification — AHA Heartsaver® eCard + AMERHA-216 ** Receive the SAME certification card as the in-person class Complete the coursework online at your own pace Then select your preferred date below for the required in-person skills check This blended learning option allows you to complete the American Heart Association’s Heartsaver® First Aid CPR AED course online, followed by a brief hands-on skills session with a certified instructor. You’ll receive your AHA eCard and USCG-approved documentation on the same day . The U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) has approved this course as meeting the following Elementary First Aid requirements: STCW Code Table A-VI/1-3: Elementary First Aid 46 CFR 11.302(a)(3) and 12.602(a)(3) 46 CFR 11.201(i)(1): First Aid and CPR training for mariner credentialing Course Includes: Adult First Aid, CPR, AED use, and choking relief (AHA Heartsaver® Total content) Course ID: AMERHA-216 Certification: AHA eCard (valid for 2 years) + AMERHA-216 USCG form — both issued same day Heartsaver® and AHA® are registered trademarks of the American Heart Association and are used with permission. This course is delivered in accordance with the AHA’s Program Administration Manual (PAM) and meets the requirements outlined by the U.S. Coast Guard National Maritime Center.

sessions.title: When:
sessions.section: Are you an expecting parent or new parent? FREE Infant CPR & Choking Relief Class Presented by 910CPR – Burgaw Office Join us for a relaxed, hands-on class that could save a life—maybe even your baby’s. You’ll laugh a little, learn a lot, and leave knowing how to handle the scary stuff calmly and correctly. ✅ Infant CPR essentials you can remember under pressure ✅ What to do if a baby is choking (step-by-step) ✅ Plenty of hands-on practice with manikins ✅ Taught by friendly, experienced EMS professionals When: Saturday, November 15, 2025 • 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM Where: 111 S. Wright Street, Burgaw, NC 28425 Questions? Call/Text (910) 395-5193 FREE for all new and expecting parents—reserve your spot today! Give your baby the best start with parents who are calm, capable, and confident. 💗 Note: This community class focuses on lifesaving skills for parents and caregivers.

sessions.title: AHA Heartsaver®CPR AED
sessions.section: AHA Heartsaver ® CPR AED (No First Aid) This CPR/AED-only class teaches how to recognize cardiac arrest, give high-quality chest compressions, use an AED, and relieve choking in adults (with optional child/infant modules as needed). No First Aid topics are included. Special note: 🎉 Free for the community! If you need an official AHA certification card for work or volunteer roles, you can choose to purchase the AHA Heartsaver CPR AED eCard during registration (issued upon successful completion). Who it’s good for / who typically needs this 🏢 Workplace teams (office, retail, hospitality, manufacturing) 🏫 School staff, teachers, bus drivers, campus personnel 🏀 Coaches, gym/fitness staff, lifeguards (when CPR/AED only is required) 👶 Childcare providers, babysitters, foster/adoptive families (when First Aid isn’t required) 🙏 Ushers/volunteers at churches & community organizations 👵 Caregivers for family members at home 🧰 Construction/trades crews whose employer or site policy specifies CPR/AED 🧑‍💼 General employees designated as on-site responders by company policy ⚠️ Not for hospital/clinical providers—choose BLS for Healthcare Providers instead What you’ll learn 🫀 Adult CPR: high-quality compressions, rescue breaths, and teamwork 🧒👶 Child & Infant CPR modules ⚡ AED operation: power-on, pad placement, safety, and shock delivery 🆘 Choking relief for adults (optional child/infant choking if selected) ⛑️ Recognizing cardiac arrest & activating EMS (scene safety, 9-1-1) 🧴 Barrier devices & hygiene considerations during CPR Certification & format ✅ AHA Heartsaver ® CPR AED eCard (optional purchase during registration) 🗓️ Valid for 2 years (upon successful completion) 👥 Instructor-led, hands-on practice with skills testing 💙 Community attendance and participation encouraged at no cost
sessions.start_text: Wednesday, December 3, 2025 at 6:00 PM Acme-Delco-Riegelwood Fire-Rescue, Inc

sessions.title: NOTE:
sessions.section: The Family & Friends CPR course is intended for anyone who wants to learn CPR and prefers to learn in an Instructor-led or facilitated group environment. This course is for people who do not need a course completion card for a job or other requirements. The course is ideal for parents, grandparents, caregivers, school groups and students, and others interested in learning how to save a life. Skills are taught using American Heart Association's research-proven practice-while-watching technique, which allows participants to practice on a CPR training manikin while skills are demonstrated in the course video. Course Content Adult Hands-Only CPR and AED Adult CPR With Breaths Mild and Severe Airway Block: How to Help a Choking Adult Child CPR and AED Mild and Severe Airway Block: How to Help a Choking Child Infant CPR Mild and Severe Airway Block: How to Help a Choking Infant NOTE: This AHA Friends and Family program is not a CERTIFICATION course.   If you need to be certified for work or school, please view these programs: BLS Provider for the healthcare professional: HeartCode - Online class with in-person skills; or, BLS - In-person class and testing HeartSaver for individuals with limited or no medical training that are required to have First Aid and/or CPR/AED to meet regulatory reasons. HeartCode - Online class with in-person skills; or, HeartSaver - In-person class and testing CPR/AED only, First Aid, CPR/AED .

sessions.title: What is covered
sessions.section: This class is for any individual who is looking for self-improvement, basic CPR for work that does not require a First Aid component (although, if desired, First Aid can be added by registering HERE ) , or families looking to ensure safety in the house and around the pool area. What is covered Adult, child and infant CPR Foreign-body airway obstruction Automated External Defibrillator (AED) Plan on spending <2 hours of interactive instruction and learning Price Includes: Education and interactive skills instruction adult, child, and infant CPR with AED American Heart Association Course completion card for Heartsaver CPR for 2 years. ***THIS COURSE IS NOT FOR HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS PROVIDING PATIENT CARE -->  Visit HERE for BLS options.

What is covered Adult, child and infant CPR Foreign-body airway obstruction Automated External Defibrillator (AED) Plan on spending <2 hours of interactive instruction and learning Price Includes: Education and interactive skills instruction adult, child, and infant CPR with AED American Heart Association Course completion card for Heartsaver CPR for 2 years. ***THIS COURSE IS NOT FOR HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS PROVIDING PATIENT CARE -->  Visit HERE for BLS options.
